title: Tashichodzong, Thimphu
description: Embark on your Bhutan package tour from Mumbai with a visit to TrashiCho Dzong in Thimphu. This grand fortress-monastery, also known as the Fortress of the Glorious Religion, is a testament to Bhutanese architecture and serves as the seat of the government.

title: Takin Zoo, Thimphu
description: As part of your Bhutan tour from Mumbai, explore the unique fauna of Bhutan at Takin Zoo in Thimphu. Home to the national animal, the takin, this sanctuary offers a rare glimpse into Bhutan's diverse wildlife.

title: Weekend Market, Thimphu
description: Dive into the vibrant culture of Bhutan by strolling through the bustling Weekend Market in Thimphu. This colorful market showcases local handicrafts, fresh produce, and traditional Bhutanese delicacies.

title: Gangtey Monastery, Phobjika
description: Gangtey Monastery in the Phobjikha Valley offers a serene escape into Bhutan's spiritual heritage. Surrounded by pristine landscapes, this monastery provides a tranquil setting for contemplation.

title: Buddha Point, Thimphu
description: Marvel at the awe-inspiring statue of Buddha Dordenma. Situated atop a hill overlooking Thimphu Valley, this iconic landmark offers panoramic views and a sense of tranquillity.

title: Tiger Nest Hiking, Paro
description: Experience the thrill of hiking to the legendary Tiger's Nest Monastery in Paro. Perched on a cliff side, this sacred site is a testament to Bhutan's rich spiritual heritage.

title: River Rafting in Punakha River, Punakha
description: Add an adventure element with exhilarating river rafting on the Punakha River. Surrounded by lush landscapes and towering mountains, this activity promises an adrenaline-filled experience.

title: Punakha Dzong, Punakha
description: Explore the architectural marvel of Punakha Dzong. Situated at the confluence of two rivers, this fortress-monastery is steeped in history and offers insight into Bhutanese culture.

title: Phobjikha Valley, Phobjikha, Gangtey
description: Discover the unspoiled beauty of Phobjikha Valley, home to endangered black-necked cranes during the winter months. This valley is a haven for nature lovers and bird enthusiasts.

title: Dochula Pass
description: Capture panoramic views of the Himalayas from Dochula Pass. Adorned with 108 memorial chortens, this mountain pass offers breath-taking vistas and photo opportunities.

title: Punakha Suspension Bridge, Punakha
description: Dare to cross the Punakha Suspension Bridge, one of the longest of its kind in Bhutan. This bridge offers thrilling views of the Punakha Valley and its surrounding scenery.

title: Chimi Lhakhang, Punakha
description: Visit Chimi Lhakhang, the fertility temple dedicated to the Divine Madman. Known for its unique phallus symbols believed to bring blessings and fertility.
